results.definition: making something valid by formally ratifying or confirming it
additional proof that something that was believed (some fact or hypothesis or theory) is correct
examples: fossils provided further confirmation of the evolutionary theory

results.definition: a ceremony held in the synagogue (usually at Pentecost) to admit as adult members of the Jewish community young men and women who have successfully completed a course of study in Judaism
a sacrament admitting a baptized person to full participation in the church
